name: Film Poster Making
description:
“Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost.”

Step into the colourful world of Bollywood and create your own filmy poster! Join us for a dynamic collage-making workshop led by renowned filmmaker and producer, Anand Tharaney. 

You’ll dive into the rich visual language of Hindi cinema, using iconic film stills and posters from MAP’s collection. You will also learn techniques to layer and blend elements that pay homage to the flamboyant aesthetics of the industry. Come express your love for cinema through art and discover the stories behind the images!

name: Make at MAP
description:
Step into the world of vibrant Indian folk art and unleash your creativity in this month's edition of Make at MAP! 

In this drop-in session, we invite you to explore the captivating style of Bhil painting, a traditional art form known for its bold colours, intricate patterns, and expressive storytelling. Inspired by the iconic works of Bhuri Bai, one of the most renowned artists from the Bhil community, this workshop offers a unique opportunity to immerse yourself in this ancient art form while putting your own spin on it.

Whether you're a seasoned artist or a first-time painter, our materials and guidance will help you bring to life your own Bhil inspired masterpiece. Learn about the rich symbolism and cultural significance behind the geometric shapes, nature motifs, and vibrant hues that define Bhuri Bai's work. The session is designed to be relaxed and open-ended, allowing you to drop-in at your own pace, experiment with different techniques, and create a painting that reflects your personal interpretation of the Bhil tradition.

name: Tuesday Tidbits
description:
How do we truly engage with art? Is it simply appreciating its aesthetic beauty, or is there more to it?

This month's Tuesday Tidbits features Shubhasree Purkayastha from our Education and Outreach team and focuses on looking beyond the surface to foster learning experiences and make meaningful connections with art. She will focus on our latest exhibition, Chay Reds, Ferrous Black, which includes a story trail especially designed for families to use as a fun journey through the show. Discussing the behind-the-scenes process of developing this, she will highlight how the education team uses exhibitions as the foundation to drive greater creative engagement.     

Tuesday Tidbits is a series that seeks to support youth in career research/building and acts as a space for networking for young people.

name: Live Sketching with Penciljam (12:00 PM)
description:
If you enjoy drawing patterns, or simply observational drawing, you will love this session. Join us for an exciting journey through textile craftsmanship as we explore the motifs in the stunning exhibit - Chay Reds, Ferrous Black. The exhibition features Palampores and textile fragments, from the 18th century, filled with exquisite motifs from both Indian and Sri Lankan cultures. During this session, we will visually explore these motifs and record them in our sketchbooks.

Towards the end of the session, we will re-imagine these motifs and personalise them, so we could paint or print them on t-shirts or tops if you wish.

Important - What you need for this session:

1. A Sketchbook or several sheets of A4 paper with an exam pad
2. Drawing Pencil (Wood or mechanical) and an eraser
3. Colour Pencils, Crayon or Felt Pens - specifically in black and Red (A dark Red, like Dark Wine)

 

If you would like to register for our 4:00PM session click here.

name: Breaking Ground with Bhuri Bai
description:
Join us for an intimate and inspiring conversation between Padma Shri recipient Bhuri Bai and Vineet Kajrolkar, Exhibitions Manager, as they delve into Bhuri Bai's extraordinary journey as the first Bhil artist to transition from traditional murals to painting on paper and canvas.

In this special discussion, Bhuri Bai will share her personal story, reflecting on the challenges and triumphs she experienced while breaking new ground for Bhil art. Known for her vibrant and intricate depictions of nature, folklore, and daily life, Bhuri Bai’s transition to canvas was a transformative moment for both her and the Bhil community's artistic heritage.

Her work, rich in symbolism and rooted in centuries-old traditions, has gained global recognition, and in this conversation, she will recount how she adapted her techniques and overcame the limitations of her environment to bring Bhil painting to a wider audience. This session will provide a unique opportunity to learn directly from a pioneering artist whose innovative spirit has shaped the contemporary landscape of Indian folk art.

Please note that this session will be delivered in Hindi - ISL interpretation will be available.

name: Conserving Personal Art
description:
What goes into art conservation? How can we prolong the life of various objects from our past and present, for future generations to enjoy? Calling out all art enthusiasts and passionate collectors, this workshop will educate you on safeguarding cultural heritage while fostering a deeper appreciation for the art around us. 

In this workshop, you can engage in an enlightening art conservation workshop where you will be introduced to many of the conservation techniques used in museums. Led by the MAP Conservation Team, learn the science behind art conservation and gain valuable insights into how to protect and prolong the life of your own treasured items.

name: Crocheting Away
description:
Learn the timeless art of creating beautiful pieces with just a hook and yarn. 

Our beginner-friendly workshop, facilitated by Bangalore's crochet group, Crafty, offers a unique opportunity to connect with fellow crafters, share stories, and learn from skilled instructors. You'll not only master fundamental techniques but also celebrate the rich tradition of crochet and pass it on to future generations. Guided by skilled instructors, you'll create beautiful pieces that honour the legacy of this art form, all while fostering new friendships and nurturing a sense of community. 

Bring your family, friends, or come solo and be part of a creative lineage. Each stitch you make will weave together tradition, creativity, and connection.

name: Dramas of Discrimination
description:
Join us for Dramas of Discrimination brought to you by the Ambedkar Reading Circle!

Participate in a unique workshop that blends systems-thinking and drama-based activities. Develop the skills to recognise and address discrimination in academic and professional settings. Grounded in the principles of fraternity and allyship, this workshop aspires to collaboratively shape a more just, liberal, and equal society for diverse communities.

The session includes a mix of paper-and-pen exercises and dramaturgical activities aimed at prompting and sensitising individuals and peer groups to identify and intervene in instances of discrimination.

This workshop has limited places. Register now to secure your spot.

The Ambedkar Reading Circle (ARC) is an anti-caste collective established in Bangalore in April 2023, inspired by Dr. Ambedkar’s call to “Organise.” ARC is dedicated to creating public spaces for anti-caste dialogue, raising awareness on caste and systemic oppression, and providing marginalised voices with a platform to share their work. Through diverse events, including book readings, poetry circles, workshops, and lecture series, ARC fosters community-driven learning and intellectual engagement on caste and related topics. By reclaiming public spaces for these discussions, ARC works toward building an inclusive community committed to dismantling caste hierarchies and promoting social justice.

name: Interpreting Contemporary Indian Art
description:
Have you been interested in contemporary art from India, but didn't know where to begin? Join this workshop organised by the MAP Academy to explore the rich histories of Indian art from the late 19th century to the present day.

This hands-on workshop is designed to empower individuals to engage meaningfully with various forms of art. Participants will build essential skills in analysing artworks, exploring significant themes and ideas, and asking meaningful questions. Through collaborative group discussions, a walkthrough of the museum, and an interactive quiz, they will gain practical experience and develop the tools needed to engage thoughtfully with new or unfamiliar works.

The workshop will build on core concepts covered in the MAP Academy’s free online course Modern and Contemporary Indian Art. Completion of the course is a prerequisite for participating in the workshop. 

This foundational course provides essential insights into key artists, movements, and socio-political contexts that have shaped Indian art, and will serve as a guide for the discussions during the workshop. Click here to enrol for the online course.

 Bring your laptop, pens, and notebook for a fully immersive experience.

Registrations for this event will open on November 22nd, 2024.
